nodes.text: Sounds like you are in a good mood.

Of course... I've got you in my heart. 
Listen to my newest song:

Just a cocky lad
Trying not to turn out bad
You knew you had to see
A better view.

Living on the city streets
Trying hard to make things meet,
You found a new way through
at Hero-U.

Doing school work
Hiding out from Mr. Terk,
Softly sneaking
until two.

Learning lessons
Making friends and having fun
That's what you do
At Hero-U!

Don't try to go slow
It's all about to show
You'll be a Hero.

Don't try to hide
I'll be by your side
Standing with pride.

Please be my beau
I want you to know
You're my hero.
So what do you think?
That's a great song. It makes me proud to be your beau.

A song like this makes it clear; it shows
That you are the best of bards and beaus.
<grin>
So you are going out with Esme?
Yes! I wrote this song about her:

Just a Rover child
Wild and lovely when she smiled
She knew she had to find
A life somewhere new.

Tired of the need to roam
All she wanted was a home.
So she planned to go
 to Hero-U.

A Rover in a caravan
Figured that she had to demand
for her right that she go to school
not to play the fool by another's rule

So she journeyed
Up and down the countryside
hoping to succeed
in her quest.

Seeking knowledge
Going off to find the college
Trying to prove
She's the best.

She can't just give in
She really wants to win
She will be true.

She'll keep trying.
Roaming woman's flying
She's now here at
Hero-U

She'll find her future
No one's gonna stop her
Here at Hero-U!
Do you think she'll like it?
Esme should be flattered that you are singing her life in words.
<grin>
It's the sort of song that Esme will never forget, try as she might.
<grin>
You think that you can win Esme's heart by singing her a flattering song? It's not going to distract her from your funny-looking face.
<sigh>
How are you feeling today?
Mostly numb. You're my only real friend, Shawn.
So are you doing anything special for the Free Day?
I've got to go to town to get a pennywhistle for the Bard final, but I can't think of anything I'd rather do than spend the evening with you.
Esme said she'd go to town with me and we'd go for a walk by the beach later on. It will be so romantic!
I need to go to town to pick up some things for the Bardic final. At least it gets me away from here for a while.

nodes.message: Adding a tag to make sure that Shawn only tells Aeolus about ending the Drat Invasion once.

nodes.text: You won't have to worry about the Drats running around in the halls now. I dealt with the problem.
Really? How did you get rid of the Drats?
I tracked the Dire Rats to her lair of their Queen. She was a huge, monstrous creature so swollen she could hardly move. She had magical powers and she could summon Drats to attack.
What did you do?
It took every skill I had to avoid her magical attacks and keep the Drats from tearing me to shreds. Finally, I slew her and all the Drats ran off.
You should have told me that you were going into danger! I would have gone with you and helped. You didn't have to risk your life alone.
Hey, don't worry... I handled it. I didn't need back up. The Queen is dead and I'm here to tell about it.
Yeah... but you could have been killed. I don't want to lose you.
Wow... you really are a hero, aren't you?
The Queen Drat was missing a magical amulet. She sent all the Drats into the castle to find it. I gave her the amulet and made her swear to keep her Drats out of the school.
Great... you really are a hero.

options.text: Get Aeolus to Clean Up the Room

nodes.text: So when are you going to clean the rest of this room up?
I'll try to get to it tomorrow.
Take note - you have the key to my heart strings.
We're in a chord... with you, my heart sings.
Clearly, we're a thing.
Shall we have a fling?
Sleep tight, good night!
Dream a little dream of me!
See you in the morning.
Is that a promise... or a warning?
